pages.text: Yunguisaurus liae is a species of late Triassic sauropterygian reptile from todayâ€™s China. This animal is known from an almost complete skeleton from the Falang formation, described for the first time in 2006.
Like other pistorasurids, Yunguisaurus sported a series of characteristics between the more basal Nothosaurids and the more derived plesiosaurids both in the skull and arms.
Unlike Nothosaurus, which had still quite developed arms, Yunguisaurus had flattened paddle like flipper more closely associated with the Jurassic long necked marine reptiles.
